articles.title: Kim Jong Il Inspects Different Units in Tanchon City
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Inspects Different Units in Tanchon City
Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il provided field guidance to different units in Tanchon City.
					 The first leg of his guidance was the Tanchon Magnesia Factory. 
					
					 He went round different production processes including the Combined Production Control Room, the Anthracite Briquette Shop, the Roofing Tile Shop and the Packing Container Shop to learn in detail about the construction, technical equipment and production there. 
					
					 Recalling that President Kim Il Sung in his lifetime was always thoughtful of putting the magnesia clinker industry on a Juche basis, he was very pleased that the factory built a modern process for producing clinker by use of anthracite abundant in the country, thereby laying solid foundation for successfully carrying out the behests of the President and making a great contribution to the nation's development of industry. 
					
					 It is possible to build a socialist thriving nation when the country builds the economy operating with locally available resources and by its own efforts and regards it as a springboard, he said, stressing that the Juche orientation is an invariable true path to be followed by the economy of the DPRK. 
					
					 Looking at the roofing tiles made with light burned magnesia produced by the factory, he said that its quality is very high. He highly praised the factory for making a great contribution to solving the problems of materials for the last stages of projects and roofing tiles. 
					
					 He also praised the factory for increasing the production of packing containers after newly building a modern process for the production of them, adding that it is important to produce lots of quality packing containers for diverse uses. 
					
					 He set forth the tasks to be implemented by the factory. 
					
					 The next leg of his guidance was the Tanchon Mining Machine Plant. 
					
					 Going round different places of the plant including the large processing workshop, he acquainted himself in detail with the work for putting large machines on a CNC basis. 
					
					 He gave a high appreciation of the achievements made by the workers and technicians of the plant, noting that it has put such large machines as 4-m and 10-m turning lathes on a CNC basis, thus making it possible to produce in time and quality more various kinds of mining equipment including large-size crusher urgently needed to keep production going at mines in the area of Tanchon.
					
					 It is a miracle that the workers of the plant in close cooperation with researchers of Kim Chaek University of Technology have put huge equipment on a CNC basis in a short span of time, boosting the precision rate of products ten times as compared with that in the past, he noted, adding that this is a striking demonstration of the validity and vitality of the WPK's policy of waging a dynamic drive to push back the frontiers of the latest science and technology. 
					
					 Pleased to see products including welding rods made by the plant by its own efforts, he highly appreciated the work style of the officials and employees of the plant conducting business activities on the principle of profitability by actively tapping inner reserves. 
					
					 If the mines are to thoroughly carry out the WPK's policy of massively mining and dressing, it is necessary for the plant to keep production going at a high rate to supply in time equipment needed by them, he stressed. 
					
					 He expressed expectation and belief that the officials and other working people of the plant would as ever achieve bigger successes in production and technological updating. 
					
					 The third leg of his guidance was the construction site of Tanchon Port. 
					
					 After being briefed on it before a large map showing its panoramic view, he went round different places of the construction site to learn in detail about the construction. 
					
					 Feasting his eyes on the breakwaters stretching far, wharf dredging sites and varieties of prefab parts for breakwaters, he expressed great satisfaction over the fact that the port construction is making very rapid progress. 
					
					 It is an astonishing miracle, indeed, for party members and other working people of the Ministry of Land and Marine Transport to successfully carry on the huge construction of Tanchon Port by the efforts of the ministry after building the Ryongnam Ship Repair Factory a few years ago, startling the world, he said, extending high appreciation and thanks to them who are successfully constructing another structure to shine long along with  the era of Songun by displaying popular heroism and matchless devotion despite difficulties and ordeals. 
					
					 Noting that this significant year the builders engaged in the reclamation of the tideland on Taegye Island turned a Western coastal area into a vast fertile land to be visited by a bumper harvest, braving rough waves, and the brave sea conquerors of the above-said ministry are now bringing about the greatest change in a Eastern coastal area, he said with pride that this signal success once again eloquently proves before the whole world that Korea can do anything when it is determined. 
					
					 It is the party's decision to make Tanchon Port resound with ships' whistle in 2012, the centenary of birth of the President, he said, setting forth the important tasks to be carried out to wind up the construction of the port earlier than scheduled.
					
					 He was accompanied by Kwak Pom Gi, chief secretary of the South Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the WPK, Kim Ki Nam and Hong Sok Hyong, members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the C.C., the WPK, Kim Kyong Hui, member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK, Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-chairman of the NDC, Pak To Chun and Thae Jong Su, alternate members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the C.C., the WPK, and Hyon Chol Hae and Ri Myong Su, department directors of the NDC.

articles.title: Talks between Choe Thae Bok and Wu Bangguo Held
articles.content:
Talks between Choe Thae Bok and Wu Bangguo Held
 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- Talks between Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, and Wu Bangguo, chairman of the Standing Committee of the Chinese National People's Congress, were held in the Great Hall of the People in Beijing on Wednesday. 
					 Present at the talks from the DPRK side were members of the delegation of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly and Ji Jae Ryong, DPRK ambassador to China, and from the Chinese side a vice-chairman of the Foreign Affairs Committee of the CNPC, Zhao Weizhu, deputy secretary general of the Standing Committee of the CNPC, Sun Wei, deputy secretary general of the Standing Committee of the CNPC who doubles as director of the Office of Chairman Wu Bangguo, and Zhang Zhijun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs.
					
					 At the talks both sides exchanged views on the issue of further developing the exchange and cooperation between the two parliaments and a series of matters of mutual concern.
					
					 The talks took place in a friendly atmosphere.
					
					 On the same day, Wu Bangguo hosted a reception in honor of the delegation of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly.
					
					 Meanwhile, Choe Thae Bok met Chen Zhili, vice-chairman of the Standing Committee of the CNPC, in the Great Hall of the People and had a talk with him in a friendly atmosphere.

articles.title: Gift from Chinese Delegation
articles.content:
Gift from Chinese Delegation
 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by a delegation of the Chinese People's Armed Police Force on a visit to the DPRK.
					 The gift was handed to an official concerned by head of the delegation Li Baolin, deputy commander of the Beijing Corps of the force, on Thursday.

articles.title: Lao Ambassador Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Lao Ambassador Hosts Reception 
 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- Lao Ambassador to the DPRK Chaleune Warinthrasak hosted a reception at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Corps Club on Thursday on the occasion of the 35th anniversary of the founding of the Lao People's Democratic Republic.
					 Present at the reception on invitation were Yang Hyong Sop, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Ryang Man Gil, chairman of the Pyongyang City People's Committee who doubles as chairman of the DPRK-Laos Friendship Association, Ri Yong Chol, vice department director of the C.C., the WPK, Pak Kil Yon, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Jon Kuk Man, vice-chairman of the Education Commission, officials concerned and diplomatic envoys of different countries and representatives of international organizations here.
					
					 Also present there were staff members of the Lao embassy.
					
					 Speeches were made at the reception.

articles.title: SPA Presidium Decree Promulgated
articles.content:
SPA Presidium Decree Promulgated
 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- A decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK was promulgated on Wednesday to reorganize the State Guidance Bureau of Resource Development into the Ministry of State Resource Development.

articles.title: Knitting Yarn Shop of Sinuiju Textile Mill Completed
articles.content:
Knitting Yarn Shop of Sinuiju Textile Mill Completed
Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- The Knitting Yarn Shop of the Sinuiju Textile Mill was completed in the DPRK with due ceremony on Thursday.
					 The officials, technicians and workers of the mill technologically updated the production building as required by the new century and finished the assembling of equipment in a matter of less than one year. 
					
					 The successful construction of the above-said production process opened a bright prospect for supplying greater quantities of yarn to the knitting mills in the west coastal areas for the mass-production of consumption goods.

articles.title: International Day of Disabled Observed
articles.content:
International Day of Persons with Disabilities Observed
 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- Disabled people had a joint gathering for 2010 at the Taedonggang Cultural Center for the Disabled in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea on Dec. 2 to mark the International Day of Persons with Disabilities.
					 Present at the gathering were Minister of Public Health Choe Chang Sik, who is also chairman of the Central Committee of the Korean Federation for the Protection of the Disabled, officials concerned, disabled persons and citizens of Pyongyang.
					
					 Members of missions of international organizations, including the European Union Programme Support, diplomatic envoys and staff members of foreign embassies here were also on hand.
					
					 Speeches were made at the gathering.
					
					 The speakers called for developing the work with the disabled by strengthening cooperation with other countries and international organizations.
					
					 The participants enjoyed an art performance given by disabled people.
					
					 They also watched art pieces and handicrafts created by them.
					
					 Meanwhile, a table-tennis tournament of disabled persons has been held at Pyongyang Indoor Stadium.

articles.title: New History Books Published
articles.content:
New History Books Published
 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- The Social Science Book Publishing House of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea has recently brought out new history books (enlarged and revised editions).
					 They involves issues related to ascertaining the history of Ancient Korea, Koguryo, Koryo and Ri Dynasty, as well as research findings in recent years, backed by a wealth of historical materials.
					
					 Among the twenty new books are "History of Korean Political System", "History of the Korean People's Anti-Aggression Struggle", "History of Korean Peasants' Uprisings" "History of Development of Korean Towns in Middle Ages", "History of Korean Mining Industry", "History of Korean Fisheries", "History of Korean Music" and "History of Korean Customs".
					
					 "History of Korean Political System" deals with Korea's political structures and its features, functions and styles ranging from the ancient times to the modern times and "History of the Korean People's Anti-Aggression Struggle" introduces their struggle against invaders in a comprehensive, scientific and theoretical way.
					
					 "History of Early Relations between Korea and Japan" (three volumes) cites old documents, archaeological evidences and names of some places to prove that Koreans began migrating to islands of Japan and settling down there in B.C. fourth-B.C. third centuries and formed minor countries.
					
					 Jo Hui Sung, director of the History Institute of the Academy of Social Science and one of the compilers, told KCNA that the books would be much helpful to the readers in getting a correct understanding of the  
					
					5 000-year-old history and brilliant culture of the Korean nation.

articles.title: Local-made Building Materials in Great Demand
articles.content:
Local-made Building Materials in Great Demand
 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- Building materials and stainless steel pipes manufactured in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea have been improved in economic effectiveness.
					Quality tiles and roofing tiles of various shapes produced by the Taedonggang General Building Material Enterprise help enhance the aesthetic value of buildings, improve their features, protect them from air pollution and prolong their serviceable life. They are in great demand in the construction of 100,000 homes in Pyongyang.
					
					 Such products of the Sungri Construction and Building Materials Joint Co., Ltd as sandwich panel for wall and arched roofing board are considered ideal prefabricated building materials.
					
					 Firebricks produced by the Korea Hyoksin Trading Company economize fuel and electricity 40-50 percent in various kinds of heat treat furnaces and kilns.
					
					 They are strong in resistance to heat and chemical change and good in heat insulation, giving no harmful effect to the working conditions and environment.
					
					 Stainless steel pipes of various shapes including glossy pipe, decorative structural pipe, pipe for foodstuff and sanitary facilities and semi-conductor products turned out by the Korea Kwangmyong Joint Venture are widely used in foodstuff and pharmaceutical industries and construction.

articles.title: Implementation of Joint Declarations Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Implementation of Joint Declarations Called for in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon) held a meeting in Seoul on Nov. 28 on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of the formation of Pomminryon.
					 Attending it were members of the south Korean Committee for Promoting the Commemorations of the 20th Anniversary of the Formation of Pomminryon and delegates of the Headquarters of Koreans in the U.S. and the European Regional Headquarters of Pomminryon.
					
					 A message of solidarity from the North Headquarters of Pomminryon was introduced at the meeting. Then followed speeches.
					
					 Speakers said that the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration clarify the idea, spirit and tasks of Pomminryon, stressing the need to preserve and implement the inter-Korean declarations in the future, too.
					
					 They called for making positive efforts to realize visits, contacts and multi-faceted dialogue and cooperation between the south and the north, oppose confrontation and war moves of the anti-reunification forces through solidarity and alliance with all the pro-reunification patriotic forces at home and abroad and achieve peace.
					
					 They noted that the reality today when the situation on the Korean Peninsula has reached the brink of an all-out war due to the moves of the Lee Myung Bak regime to escalate the confrontation requires all the forces aspiring after independence, democracy and reunification to wage a more dynamic movement for reunification.
					
					 They declared that they would check and frustrate the anti-reunification moves of the conservative forces through the unity of the progressive camp and the alliance of the forces supporting the June 15 joint declaration and make a positive contribution to achieving the democracy of the society and national reunification.

articles.title: Japanese Authorities' Discriminating Policy Flayed
articles.content:
Japanese Authorities' Discriminating Policy Flayed
Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- Organizations of Korean residents in Japan held a press conference in the Hall No. 1 of members of the House of Representatives of Japan on Nov. 25 denouncing the Japanese authorities for their moves to put off the application of the tuition-waiver program for senior high schools to the Korean schools. 
					 An emergency statement was read out at the press conference in the name of the Society of Principals of Korean High Schools, the Liaison Council of the Society of Mothers of Korean Students, the Liaison Society of Students of Korean High Schools and director-generals of Korean schools from different parts of Japan.
					
					 The statement accused the chief cabinet secretary and the minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology of Japan of asserting on Nov. 24 that it was advisable to stop the procedures for applying the tuition-waiver program to the Korean schools now that the situation has grown tense on the Korean Peninsula and the prime minister of instructing the above-said minister to halt the procedures.
					
					  It is illogical for them to link the application of the above-said program to the students of Korean schools engrossed in study to the situation, it deplored, and continued:
					
					 This runs counter to the purpose of the tuition-waiver program and what the above-said minister officially declared in his statement concerning the issue of tuition-waiver program for Korean schools early in November.
					
					 It is intolerable that only students of Korean schools are subject to serious national discrimination, the statement noted, urging the Japanese government to immediately apply the tuition-waiver program to the Korean schools as early as possible.

articles.title: DPRK's Economic Development Introduced
articles.content:
DPRK's Economic Development Introduced
 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- The Group for the Study of the Juche Idea "Kanggye" of Colombia issued a bulletin "The Juche idea and DPRK's economic development" on Nov. 22.
					 The bulletin said in an article that the DPRK's economy which faced difficulties owing to the extreme sanctions and blockade of the U.S.-led imperialist allied forces and consecutive years of natural disasters in the closing years of the last century has weathered the hardships in a brief span of time, putting an economic power on the horizon.
					
					  A master key to unfolding such eye-opening reality in the DPRK is that it has fully met the requirements of the Juche idea in economic construction, the bulletin noted, adding that the DPRK has laid a new economic foundation and conducted the technological updating as required by the 21st century by its own efforts and with its own technology.
					
					 The bulletin gave a detailed account of the fact that the DPRK is producing machines and equipment requiring a high level of technology with its own technology.
					
					 The Korean people have long made strenuous efforts to cement the foundation of the independent national economy, regarding it a fundamental principle to build an economy which stands on its own feet, not subject to others, an economy serving them and making progress relying on their resources and efforts, stressed the bulletin.

articles.title: Songun Politics Praised
articles.content:
Songun Politics Praised
 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- Lyne Sinyodyium, councilor of the European Society for the Study of the Juche Idea, who visited the DPRK, said that the Korean people have a rosy future as they are stepping up the building of a great prosperous and powerful nation,  true to the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il. 
					 She went on:
					
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il has pursued the original Songun politics by carrying forward the Songun idea of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Socialism in the DPRK has been firmly safeguarded thanks to Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Under his Songun leadership the DPRK has demonstrated its might as an independent power.
					
					 The DPRK has turned into a military power, enjoying a higher international prestige.
					
					 The Songun politics serves as an all-powerful treasured sword providing a firm guarantee for the building of a great prosperous and powerful socialist nation.
					
					 The Korean people are now registering great successes in various fields including politics, economy and culture.
					
					 I was deeply impressed to visit the E-Library and the Indoor Swimming Pool of Kim Il Sung University, the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm and modern factories, rural villages and recreation grounds.
					
					 The Korean people are working miracles and innovations in production and construction full of faith and optimism.
					
					 They are working hard to improve the standard of people's living, united close around Kim Jong Il.
					
					 It is their firm determination to open the gate to a thriving nation without fail.
					
					 The Korean people advancing under the banner of Songun are sure to emerge victorious.

articles.title: Story of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Medicines, Medical Appliances for Footballers
Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- One April day in Juche 62 (1973) General Secretary Kim Jong Il summoned a doctor belonging to the April 25 Football Team.
					Coming into the leader's office, the doctor saw boxes of medicines piled up there.
					
					After opening some of the boxes, Kim Jong Il explained the usage and efficacy of the medicines to the doctor.
					
					 The doctor was amazed to find he had a deep medical knowledge.
					
					Kim Jong Il guided the doctor to another room to show him electrocardiograph, tonometer and other medical appliances. He said they were valuable things even big hospitals lacked and that it would be good to send them to a gymnasium now under reconstruction.
					
					The newly developed medicines and medical appliances were a token of Kim Jong Il's deep concern for the country's sports development.

articles.title: ATCC culpa a EE.UU. de proliferacion nuclear
articles.content:
ATCC culpa a EE.UU. de proliferacion nuclear
Pyongyang, 2 de diciembre (ATCC) -- En estos tiempos, centra la atencion de la sociedad internacional un articulo del periodico singapurense Straits Times que confirma la posesion de armas nucleares por Israel.
					Segun el rotativo, durante las conservaciones con la premier israeli Golda Meir sostenidas en 1969, el entonces presidente norteamericano Nixon concerto un convenio secreto, en el cual EE.UU. se comprometio a admitir la capacidad nuclear de Israel y dejar de presionarlo para que firmara el Tratado de No Proliferacion a condicion de que ese ultimo no publique arbitrariamente su capacidad nuclear.
					
					Los sucesivos mandatarios norteamericanos, inclusive la actual administracion Obama, observan estrictamente ese convenio.
					
					  Por su parte, Israel practica desde entonces la politica NCND (no confirmar ni negar) en el tema de sus armas nucleares.
					
					   Este articulo es una prueba que demuestra claramente la situacion de desarrollo de armas nucleares por Israel y lo injusto de la pauta de doble rasero de EE.UU. en el problema nuclear.
					
					  La teoria de posesion de armas nucleares del pais hebreo deviene desde hace mucho tiempo una de las importantes polemicas de la sociedad internacional.
					
					  Israel comenzo a impulsar secretamente su programa nuclear ya a finales de la decada de 1940 e intento obtener la tecnica de fabricacion de armas nucleares. 
					
					  En el periodo de la tercera Guerra del Medio Oriente, tenia 15 ojivas nucleares y esta cifra se incremento a 200 en la decada de 1980.
					
					Ademas, estan en posesion de Israel centenares de toneladas de sustancias para fabricar las armas nucleares.
					
					  Asi Israel se ha convertido en el sexto portador mas grande de armas nucleares del mundo.
					
					  El armamentismo nuclear de Israel conto con el activo apoyo tecnico y material y el amparo tacito de EE.UU.
					
					  Segun su decision de "ayudar" el desarrollo nuclear de Israel, el imperio envio a sus fisicos nucleares y el uranio altamente enriquecido.
					
					  Ademas, amparo tacitamente a Israel cuando la posesion y la proliferacion de armas nucleares de este pais producian un gran revuelo en todo el mundo. 
					
					  Sucedio lo mismo cuando el periodico  britanico Guardian revelo este ano que en la decada de 1970 hubo conversaciones secretas entre los gobiernos israeli y sudafricano sobre el trafico de armas nucleares. 
					
					Para colmo, la jefa de la diplomacia norteamericana elogio a Israel diciendo que este pais "puede hacer muchas cosas" para impedir la adquisicion de sustancias nucleares por parte de los terroristas, la cual causa mayor preocupacion del mundo.
					
					Estimulado por el apoyo de EE.UU., Israel insiste en que la sociedad internacional no tiene derecho a presionarlo en el tema nuclear y se atrevio a acusar a algunos paises diciendo que "estos amenazan su existencia".
					
					Estos datos demuestran claramente que EE.UU. es complice y colaborador en el armamentismo nuclear de Israel. 
					
					Si bien hace vista gorda, defiende y hasta colabora con los "paises aliados" y satelites, el imperio cuestiona las actividades nucleares con fines pacificos de los paises, que no le agradan, describiendolos como "criminales nucleares". 
					
					Esta actitud de doble cara se manifiesta coherentemente en los casos de la RPDC e Iran.
					
					Por otra parte, el imperio norteamericano acelera la modernizacion de sus armas nucleares.
					
					Hace poco, EE.UU. realizo la prueba nuclear subcritica bajo el pretexto de "asegurar la estabilidad de su arsenal nuclear" y pretende desembolsar 4 mil millones de US $ para la modernizacion de instalaciones nucleares.
					
					De esta manera, la administracion Obama, que preconiza el "mundo sin armas nucleares", expuso su siniestra intencion.
					
					El proyecto del "mundo desnuclearizado" de EE.UU. no pasa de ser una cortina de humos para ocultar su ambicion de dominar el mundo con armas nucleares y enganar a la humanidad.
					
					Al perseguir de continuo su ambicion nuclear, ese portador de armas nucleares no. 1 del mundo y criminal de guerra nuclear comete otro peor crimen contra la humanidad.
					
					Nadie tiene derecho a actuar arbitrariamente en el tema nuclear ni aplicar la pauta de doble rasero.
					
					Recae enteramente sobre EE.UU la responsabilidad del crecimiento a escala mundial de la amenaza nuclear y peligro de proliferacion nuclear.

articles.title: Inaugurado el taller de hilado en Fabrica Textil de Sinuiju
articles.content:
Inaugurado el taller de hilado en Fabrica Textil de Sinuiju
Pyongyang, 2 de diciembre (ATCC) -- En Corea quedo inaugurado el dia 2 el taller de hilado construido nuevamente en la Fabrica Textil de Sinuiju.
					Los funcionarios, tecnicos y obreros de la fabrica reconstruyeron el edificio de produccion conforme a la demanda del nuevo siglo y terminaron el montaje de los equipos en menos de un ano.
					
					Asi fueron abiertas las perspectivas de enviar  mucho mas hilos a las fabricas de tejidos de punto de la zona del Mar Oeste de Corea para que ellas puedan producir en masas los articulos de consumo necesarios a la vida del pueblo.

articles.title: Nace Ministerio de Desarrollo de Recursos Estatales
articles.content:
Nace Ministerio de Desarrollo de Recursos Estatales
Pyongyang, 2 de diciembre (ATCC) -- La Direccion de Desarrollo de Recursos Estatales ha sido reorganizada como Ministerio de Desarrollo de Recursos Estatales.
					Fue publicado la vispera el decreto correspondiente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.

articles.title: El embajador y el agregado militar de Cuba ofrecen banquete
articles.content:
El embajador y el agregado militar de Cuba ofrecen banquete 
Pyongyang, 2 de diciembre (ATCC) -- El embajador de la Republica de Cuba en Corea, Jose Manuel Galego Montano, y el agregado militar de la sede diplomatica cubana, Leonardo Perez Mesa, ofrecieron el dia primero en el Club para el Cuerpo Diplomatico Taedonggang un banquete en ocasion del 54o aniversario del dia de las Fuerzas Armadas Revolucionarias de Cuba.
					En la ocasion fueron invitados el viceministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares Pak Jae Gyong, generales y oficiales del Ejercito Popular de Corea, y otros funcionarios coreanos, los representantes diplomaticos de varios paises y los agregados militares de embajadas.
					
					Tambien estuvieron presentes los miembros de la embajada cubana.
					
					En el acto hubo discursos.
